阅读知天下第006期 ... 3. on the fly 疲于奔命，急忙地，匆忙地。 4. inroad n. 得手，进展。 2、Right hand 得力助手。.

list.abs: European internet gambling companies have made inroads into the US in spite of the ban ., 欧洲互联网赌博公司已不顾禁令进军美国.

halfway the target date , there are heartening examples of dramatic progress , as the 91 percent reduction in measles deaths in Africa and new inroads against malaria .现在我们已经走了一半的路程，这期间出现了令人振奋的大幅进展，例如非洲的麻疹致死率已经降低91%，对抗疟疾的行动也有了新策略。
already the children had made considerable inroads on the food ., 孩子们早已吃掉不少食物.
the candidate made surprising inroads in the south ., 那位候选人在南方出人意料地大为得手.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in sense 2): from in + road (from an early use in the sense 'riding')

sentences.sentence: "they made inroads in the United States market"

auth_sentence.content: I think it's a very important inroad to understanding consciousness.

sentences.en: We have made inroads into our painting job;we finished the kitchen already.
